column4: is there a software from which i can monitor my cpu tempreture?
temperature*
I get the best results with mbmon. It's kernel- and ACPI-independent.
which one the x-mbmon or mbmon?
you definitely need mbmon. xmbmon is optional
how to run it?
'sudo mbmon'
is x-mbmon gui?
there are a few of them, why?
cause yesterday i made a post it said that it won't be in the forums before a moderator checks it
and it's not in the forums till now
I see, you mean ubuntuforums. Sorry, I guess you have to be patient still
is any of the moderators online now?
I don't know. Sorry, I thought you meant channel moderators.
yes
gunzip is the default tool to extract .gz files
even if you run some gui program, it'll use gunzip in the background

but what happened is that i extracted the file.gz using GUI tool and copied it to a specific folder but the program after running didn't recognize that file, while when i used gunzip -c winamp_presets.gz > ~/.xmms/eq.preset it worked
the difference is the invocation. Your gui prog will have uncompressed it to winamp_presets, not to the target name you specified.
nope.. it extracted it to eq.preset
what what? Shift-Alt-Fx isn't the right combination.
sorry, didn't mean you
what have you changed since it worked?
i didn't change anything. i was just browsing normaly
